So, writing the code:

First, include necessary headers:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

Define MOD as 1e9+7:

#define MOD 1000000007LL

Then, implement GCD:

long long gcd(long long a, long long b) {
    while (b != 0) {
        long long temp = b;
        b = a % b;
        a = temp;
    }
    return a;
}

Then, implement modular exponentiation:

long long pow_mod(long long base, long long exponent, long long mod) {
    long long result = 1;
    base = base % mod;
    while (exponent > 0) {
        if (exponent % 2 == 1) {
            result = (result * base) % mod;
        }
        exponent = exponent >> 1;
        base = (base * base) % mod;
    }
    return result;
}

Then, read N and the array A:

int main() {
    int N;
    scanf("%d", &N);
    long long *A = (long long *)malloc(N * sizeof(long long));
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        scanf("%lld", &A[i]);
    }

    long long current_lcm = 1;
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        long long g = gcd(current_lcm, A[i]);
        current_lcm = current_lcm / g * A[i];
        // To avoid overflow, check if current_lcm exceeds (1e18) or something, but not possible here.
        // However, if current_lcm exceeds LLONG_MAX (9e18), this will overflow.
        // So this is a potential problem.
    }

    long long sum_inv = 0;
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
        sum_inv = (sum_inv + pow_mod(A[i], MOD-2, MOD)) % MOD;
    }

    long long ans = (current_lcm % MOD) * (sum_inv % MOD) % MOD;
    printf("%lld\n", ans);

    free(A);
    return 0;
}
